image.altText: A portrait of a man in a gymnasium.

props.synopsis: There seems to be some awareness independents are better organised this ACT election, but the question is whether independent-curious vibes will translate to a meaningful number of votes.

title.children: 'An "It's Time" vibe': The independents hoping to shake up Canberra's status quo

image.altText: An INTERFET Australian soldier talking to a boy in East Timor, file photo

props.synopsis: September 20 marks 25 years since Australia deployed peacekeepers to Timor-Leste to quell violence.

title.children: 'They were still setting fire to houses': What Australians saw when they arrived in East Timor 25 years ago

image.altText: A group of trees in a forest.

props.synopsis: The Liberals have released their housing policy ahead of next month's ACT election, with plans for a large development on the eastern edge of the territory.

title.children: Kowen Forest to be developed for housing as part of Canberra Liberals election promise

image.altText: A portrait of woman in a large room.

props.synopsis: Dr Anita Hutchison is supporting a pilot program that will train GPs to recognise the signs of domestic violence and child sexual abuse.Â

title.children: Anita says she was asked 'can't you just forgive him?' as she tried to flee domestic violence. She wants that to change

image.altText: Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory

props.synopsis: Former army officer cadet Jake Sullivan is on trial for six charges including rape, committing an act of indecency and assault.

title.children: 'I never forced her': Former army cadet denies raping woman

image.altText: A black cat lies down on a towl with a cone around its neck.

props.synopsis: The RSPCA's ACT branch issues an appeal for information after multiple reported cases of animal cruelty in Canberra's north.

title.children: 'Incredibly cruel': Cats discovered with bound testicles in Canberra's north

image.altText: A portrait of a doctor wearing a stethoscope around her neck, seated next to a desk.

props.synopsis: Junior doctors in Canberra worried that unpaid overtime was putting themselves and their patients at risk. They have now reached a settlement with the ACT government.

title.children: Canberra junior doctors given $31.5 million after suing over unpaid overtime

image.altText: A man is arrested by officers

props.synopsis: A major criminal network alleged to have sold $1.8 billion of cocaine has been dismantled in a series of police raids.

title.children: Police dismantle Sydney crime network they allege sold $1.8b worth of cocaine in four months

image.altText: A close up of a grey-headed flying fox hanging upside down in a tree.

props.synopsis: A live-streaming camera is offering insights into a grey-headed flying fox colony in northern NSW, aiming to change public perception that the animals are pests, and guide conservation work.Â

title.children: BatCam offers glimpse into secret life of 'very, very cool' threatened flying fox species

image.altText: A large cloud of smoke rises from a hillside village

props.synopsis: Israeli warplanes carry out their most intense strikes on southern Lebanon in nearly a year of war, heightening the conflict between Israel and Lebanese militant group Hezbollah.

title.children: Israel unleashes heavy strikes on Lebanon as its allies urge restraint

image.altText: Hundreds of people gather outside a hospital between ambulances

props.synopsis: Exploding pagers and walkie-talkies across Lebanon prompt calls for investigations, as several UN and human rights officials say the use of "booby-trapped" devices contravenes international humanitarian laws.

title.children: Did the exploding pagers and walkie-talkies in Lebanon breach international law?

image.altText: A nuclear cooling plant

props.synopsis: Two reports that suggest nuclear power would push up power bills by hundreds of dollars and leave as much as half of Australia's energy demands unmet are being used by the government to tighten the screws on the Coalition over its nuclear proposal.

title.children: In a void of detail, two reports attempt to spell the challenge for Peter Dutton to go nuclear

image.altText: A man with a bulletproof vest stands by a black police truck in front of a hedge fence and a shed.

props.synopsis: Another apparent attempt to assassinate Donald Trump leads to a blame game, some troubling questions and an awful sense of deja vu in the United States.Â

title.children: The US election race has taken another dark turn amid heightened fears of further political violence

image.altText: A composite image of the woman and man in seperate images.

props.synopsis: The Australian Federal Police allege Kira Korolev travelled to Russia while on leave with the ADF and instructed her husband to log into her work account to send sensitive material.

title.children: Alleged Russian spy couple do not make court appearance as police seize 12 devices in ongoing investigation

image.altText: Two Chinese flags flutter in the wind at a shipping port.

props.synopsis: With the Chinese economy slowing and authorities cracking down on "gratuitous" spending, Australia's export industries are being exposed and impacted in different ways.

title.children: How a push to end 'gratuitous' spending in China could make Australian exporters nervous

image.altText: A composite image of Anthony Albanese and Joe Biden.

props.synopsis: US President Joe Biden will host Anthony Albanese and the other Quad leaders in his home state of Delaware, with the discussions aimed at ensuring security in the Indo-Pacific region.

title.children: China will be 'high on the agenda' during Albanese's fleeting visit to the US this weekend

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market has hit another record high in the wake of interest rate cuts in the United States. The Bank of Japan has kept rates steady at 0.25%. Follow the day's events and insights as they happenÂ withÂ our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.Â

title.children: ASX hits record high, Myer drops after profit slump

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX rises 0.2% for fifth-straight record close

image.altText: Centrelink sign.

props.synopsis: Here is a list of payments increasing â and by how much â from September 20. Â

title.children: Multiple Centrelink payments are increasing today. Here's what you need to know

image.altText: A graphic with mouse traps and logos from major banks and telcos.

props.synopsis: Scammers are destroying people's lives â a crackdown on who will cough up when things go wrong has stakeholders divided, writes Michael Atkin.Â

title.children: Scammers are destroying people's lives â who should cough up if there are systemic failures?

image.altText: The spire of an old church, visible in the distance, through trees.

props.synopsis: Mazan was once synonymous with the best of the south of France: vineyards on one side, lavender fields to the other. Now it's at the centre of a high-profile rape trial, and prosecutors say some of the men here have a dark secret.

title.children: This tiny French town became the centre of a rape trial, and 'everybody knows at least one man involved'

image.altText: A close up from behind of a woman on the phone

props.synopsis: One in six women have experienced economic abuse at the hands of their partner, according to the Australian Bureau of Statistics. For culturally and linguistically diverse women, it can be particularly difficult to access support.

title.children: Rani's husband spent thousands of dollars on sex work, then took everything. She doesn't know where to go for support

image.altText: An Australian football coach sits at a desk speaking into a microphone during a press conference.

props.synopsis: Having led the team since 2018, Arnold is standing down after poor performances in recent World Cup qualifiers.Â

title.children: 'My gut has told me it's time': Graham Arnold quits as Socceroos head coach

image.altText: A restaurant is packed with people eating food in a brightly-lit setting

props.synopsis: The South Korean cultural phenomenon shows no signs of slowing as Melbourne announces its official Koreatown.

title.children: How Australia's newest K-town reflects the growing influence of Korea's culture on our cities

image.altText: A woman stands crying standing next to another woman.

props.synopsis: The mother of Rachel McCrow, one of the police officers murdered at Wieambilla, makes an emotional plea ahead of National Police Remembrance Day.

title.children: Family of slain police officer in Wieambilla attack still struggles with 'mental demons' as request for support service skyrockets

image.altText: A white cylindrical submersible descends through water at an angle.

props.synopsis: Appearing before a US Coast Guard panel, Steven Ross says the experimental submersible experienced a platform issue before the vessel imploded.Â

title.children: Titan submersible's scientific director says it malfunctioned prior to fatal dive

image.altText: A woman and her son looking out at a beach

props.synopsis: The number of "accidental" homeschooled students is increasing across Australia, and some families are reporting positive outcomes.

title.children: Australia has a growing number of 'accidental' homeschool students, and COVID is only part of the reason

image.altText: Berta Frangieh, a young woman with brown hair, stares into the camera

props.synopsis: About 1,300 Palestinians with visitor visas have resettled in Australia since October, but their visa doesn't allow for work or study rights. They are now trying to establish their careers in a new country after fleeing Gaza.

title.children: Palestinians in Australia left in limbo as visa doesn't allow for work or study rights

image.altText: Steven King speaks to Cats players during a 2024 AFL match.

props.synopsis: Geelong assistant coach Steven King is taken to hospital after suffering a medical episode as the Cats prepared for Saturday's preliminary final against the Brisbane Lions.

title.children: 'Quite confronting': Cats assistant coach hospitalised after collapsing at training ahead of prelim final

image.altText: Mine conveyor belt sprays coal in the air into a pile dug from a mine at Oaky Creek near Middlemount in central Qld

props.synopsis: The Fair Work Ombudsman has secured a total of $657,105 in penalties in court against the Mining and Energy Union and five then-union officials over conduct including verbal abuse of workers at the Oaky Creek North coal mine in central Queensland.

title.children: Mining and Energy Union and officials fined more than half a million dollars for 'intimidating and threatening' conduct

image.altText: Telstra payphones in Birdsville

props.synopsis: The telco says emergency calls from public phones have risen by about 20 per cent, and the anonymity they provide for people experiencing mental health crises and domestic violence could be a driving factor.

title.children: Telstra registers uptick in calls to helplines from public phones since service became free

image.altText: A composite image of an asteroid on a starry background.

props.synopsis: A small asteroid may become a "mini-moon" of Earth's for a couple of months, according to some astronomers. But what makes something a mini-moon, and why are they so hard to spot?

title.children: An asteroid will soon be temporarily looped into Earth's orbit. But does that make it a 'moon'?

image.altText: Flowers and animals marking a memorial at a fence in front of a body of water

props.synopsis: The Queensland Supreme Court has heard a father charged over the death of his unattended young daughter had been taking drugs and was sleep deprived in the lead-up to the tragedy.

title.children: Father found guilty of non-verbal, autistic daughter's manslaughter after drowning death

image.altText: Champs12

props.synopsis: Greg Champion is a serious songwriter with a not-so-serious back catalogue. But with That's The Thing About Football, the lanky songwriter from Adelaide found a footy anthem that will stand the test of time.

title.children: Mike Brady, Paul Kelly, and the second Bronson â how a footy song from the 90s became an AFL icon

image.altText: A composite image showing a sign that says dog beer. Rupert Murdoch and a green bag with a B on it.

props.synopsis: Are you across this week's news headlines? Put yourself to the test.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Dog beer, a Murdoch battle and a controversial green bag
